job_description:
Welcome to All scripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, All scripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.

Responsibilities
• * Design, develop and maintain large-scale, service-oriented architectures to quickly analyze terabytes of patient data
• Develop and maintain APIs and analytic modules within an existing Python-based data processing framework
• Liaise with Business Analysts and/or internal / external customers to ensure that requirements are understood
• Produce accurate, unambiguous technical design specifications to the required level of detail in the timescales as defined by the PM
• Prepare and execute unit test plans
• Produce efficient and fully documented code
• Develop supporting technical and installation documentation for internal and external publication
• Achieve productivity targets in order to ensure developments are delivered within budget, to schedule and to defined quality standards
• Complete all necessary software and non-software components in the timelines as defined by the PM
• Manage work tasks with minimal supervision
• Quality and adherence to Standards
• Develop Tech Specs, Code and/s in line with the Traceability Matrix/Functional Specification.
• Ensure all work is reviewed to ensure adherence to the relevant development standards
• Complete peer work and code reviews
• Provide timely and accurate reporting of project status as required by PM
• Determine accurate and detailed development work estimates
• Escalate product issues in a timely fashion and suggest product improvements
• Mentor team members in best practices and standards

Qualifications
• Academic and Professional

Qualifications:
• S. in Computer Science, EE, or similar technical discipline
• Excellent programming skills in Python, Java, C#, C++, or similar language
• Background in math, statistics, public health or epidemiology preferred
• Excellent application documentation skills
• Excellent communication skills
• Experience:
• 5+ years of experience as a software engineer.
• At least 1 year working as a software developer on large distributed systems and client server architectures.
• 3+ years Python development using frameworks like Flask, Django, Jinja, SQL Alchemy
• Prefer experience with asynchronous processing and messaging using Celery and messaging queue such as RabbitMQ
• Experience building and deploying applications using Amazon Web Services or similar cloud infrastructure.
• Software development in life sciences / pharmaceutical industry preferred.
• Validated software development in a regulated environment preferred.
• Development/testing of RESTful APIs.
• Experience with Apache HTTP, NGINX, Tomcat, or Jetty.
• SQL database experience (Redshift, Postgre

SQL, MySQL, or similar).
• Experience with standard build tools and version control systems (e.g., Git, Jenkins).
• Broad understanding of internet protocols and network programming.
• Experience working in a Linux environment.
• Experience with containers and building container images.
• Adept at researching application errors and using debugging tools.
• Desire experience integrating and configuring Elasticsearch.

We strongly advocate that our associates receive all CDC recommended vaccinations in prevention of COVID-19.

Visa Sponsorship is not offered for this position.

At All scripts, our greatest strength comes from bringing together talented people with diverse perspectives to support the technology needs of 180,000 physicians, 1,500 hospitals and 10,000 postacute organizations across the globe. All scripts offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package, including holidays, vacation, medical, dental, and vision insurance, company paid life insurance and retirement savings.

All scripts' policy is to provide equal employment opportunity and affirmative action in all of its employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression r legally protected category. Applicants for North American based positions with All scripts must be legally authorized to work in the United States or Canada.

Verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire. All scripts is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursing and hiring a diverse and inclusive workforce.

From a "VEVRAA Federal Contractor" We request Priority Referral of Protected Veterans

This is an official All scripts Job posting. To avoid identity theft, please only consider applying to jobs posted on our official corporate site.

Thank you for reviewing this All scripts opportunity! Does this look like a great…

job_description:
Hope you are doing well. We have an urgent position for Python Developers in NY and TX.

Please share a suitable profile if you’ve. Please send your resume to Varma@hermitageinfotech.com or call Varma at 732-593-8453 Extension 202 for any questions or call 732-231-6194 directly. Please mention your visa status, current location, minimum expected salary, and availability to start a new project.

Role: Python Developer with 6 – 10 years of genuine experience

Location: New York andTX

Duration: 12+ months

Job brief

We are looking for a Python Developer to join our engineering team and help us develop and maintain various software products.

Python Developer responsibilities include writing and testing code, debugging programs and integrating applications with third-party web services. To be successful in this role, you should have experience using server-side logic and work well in a team.

Ultimately, you’ll build highly responsive web applications that align with our business needs.

Responsibilities
• Write effective, scalable code
• Develop back-end components to improve responsiveness and overall performance
• Integrate user-facing elements into applications
• Test and debug programs
• Improve functionality of existing systems
• Implement security and data protection solutions
• Assess and prioritize feature requests
• Coordinate with internal teams to understand user requirements and provide technical solutions

Requirements
• Work experience as a Python Developer.
• Expertise in at least one popular Python framework (like Django, Flask)
• Knowledge of object-relational mapping (ORM)
• Familiarity with front-end technologies (like JavaScript)
• Team spirit
• Good problem-solving skills
• Knowledge of virtualenv concept.
• Git/GitHub

Varma

Hermitage Infotech, LLC

P:732-593-8453 Extension 202

F:732-289-6103

varma@hermitageinfotech.com

www.hermitageinfotech.com

Qualifications: Work experience as a Python Developer
Expertise in at least one popular Python framework (like Django, Flask)
Knowledge of object-relational mapping (ORM)
Familiarity with front-end technologies (like JavaScript)
Team spirit
Good problem-solving skills
Knowledge of virtualenv concept

Develop back-end components to improve responsiveness and overall performance

job_description:
If you are a Python Back-end Engineer with experience, please read on!

Job Title: Python Back-End Developer

Job Location: Remote / Hybrid

Job Salary: $120,000 - $145,000

Requirements
• Minimum of 2 years in Python development
• Experience with Django
• Minimum of 2 years experience with RDBMS (PostgreSQL)
• Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science (or related field)

We provide AI solutions that automate answering of questions for a variety of applications, including support centers, service reps, chatbots, and more. If you are a Python developer who thrives in a high-energy, collaborative environment, have an innovative and entrepreneurial mind-set, and are looking to launch your career - apply today!

What You Will Be Doing

As a Python Back-end Developer you will be collaborating with front-end and AI engineers, but must also be able to work independently. Some of the duties include writing code, designing and building back-end logic, code review, and monitoring server database performance.

What You Need for this Position

Requirements
• Minimum of 2 years experience as a Python developer
• Experience with Django, or ability to learn quickly
• Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science (or related field)

Bonus Skills
• Experience with RDBMS (PostgreSQL)
• MongoDB
• Elasticsearch
• Kafka
• Docker, Kubernetes
• Bilingual in Korean or Japanese

What's In It for You
• Salary: $120,000 - $145,000
• Vacation/PTO
• Medical & Dental
• Education and wellness reimbursement
• Work-from-home equipment reimbursement

Benefits
• Vacation/PTO
• Medical
• Dental
• Education and wellness reimbursement
• Work-from-home equipment reimbursement

So, if you are a Python Back-end Engineer with experience, please apply today!

Email Your Resume In Word To

Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also:

Rachelle.Struss@CyberCoders.com
• Please do NOT change the email subject line in any way. You must keep the JobID: linkedin : RS15-1703806L387 -- in the email subject line for your application to be considered.***

Rachelle Struss - Recruiter - CyberCoders

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science (or related field)

Experience with Django, or ability to learn quickly
MongoDB
Docker, Kubernetes

Experis, a Manpower Group company has an exciting contract opportunity for Python developer with Linux and DB experience - Onsite position. This position is contract role for one of our key clients, A purpose-led organization that is building a meaningful future through innovation, technology, and collective knowledge.

Python developer with Linux and DB experience

Location
- Sunnyvale, Austin, Seattle

Count: 2 Positions

Key Success Factors
• 5+ years developing large scale enterprise software
• Strong programming skills (ability to create efficient algorithms and data structures)
• Expertise in one or more of the following programming languages:
Go (required), Java, C, Rust, Scala
• Expertise in the following scripting languages:
Python (required), Shell script
• Expertise in one or more of the following query languages: SQL (required), No

SQL, SparkSQL

• Good working knowledge of version control and repositories such as Git, and CI/CD process
• Good understanding and at least a basic working knowledge in socket programming (TCP/IP, HTTP/S, etc.)
• Experience in cloud and container based deployments, using AWS, Kubernetes etc. is a plus
• Experience in security and vulnerabilities is a plus
• Driven to automate and continuously improve
• Passionate about keeping our customers data safe
• Ability to track and manage numerous parallel activities
• Track record of practical problem solving, excellent communication and documentation skills
• Comfortable in a fast-paced dynamic agile environment
• High standard of ethics
• Good knowledge of integrating, analyzing, and presenting relevant metrics for very large data sets

job_description:
Python, Django, SQL, Snowflake, Oracle

Dallas, TX and Tampa, FL

Experience level: Mid-senior Experience required: 6 Years Education level: Bachelor’s degree Job function: Information Technology Industry: Financial Services Total position: 1 Relocation assistance: No Visa : Only US citizens and Greencard holders

JOB DESCRIPTION:

The Development family is responsible for creating, designing, deploying, and supporting applications, programs, and software solutions.

May include research, new development, prototyping, modification, reuse, re-engineering, maintenance, or any other activities related to software products used internally or externally on product platforms supported by the firm.

The software development process requires in-depth subject matter expertise in existing and emerging development methodologies, tools, and programming languages. Software Developers work closely with business partners and / or external clients in defining requirements and implementing solutions.

The Software Engineering role specializes in planning, documenting technical requirements, designing, developing, and testing all software systems and applications for the firm. Works closely with architects, product managers, project management, and end-users in the development and enhancement of existing software systems and applications, proposing and recommending solutions that solve complex business problems.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Act as a technical expert on one or more applications utilized by DTCC

Work with the Business System Analyst to ensure designs satisfy functional requirements

Partner with Infrastructure to identify and deploy optimal hosting environments

Tune application performance to eliminate and reduce issues

Research and evaluate technical solutions consistent with DTCC technology standards

Align risk and control processes into day-to-day responsibilities to monitor and mitigate risk; escalates appropriately

Apply different software development methodologies dependent on project needs

Contribute expertise to the design of components or individual programs, and participate in the construction and functional testing

Support development teams, testing, troubleshooting, and production support

Create applications and construct unit test cases that ensure compliance with functional and non-functional requirements

Work with peers to mature ways of working, continuous integration, and continuous delivery

QUALIFICATIONS:

Strong hands-on experience in developing software applications using Python and related technologies.

Experience in building Django / Flask based App server, API development

Experience in developing applications from Scratch including an understanding of setting up the dependencies on the server.

Good understanding of JavaScript, React, HTML, CSS

Knowledge of SDLC, Testing & CI/CD aspects such as Jenkins, BB, JIRA

Knowledge of Database concepts and ability to write SQL queries

Experience in developing distributed data processing systems

Knowledge of working on Distributed Autosys / Scheduling

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience in developing software and services in cloud environments like AWS

Experience in snowflake

Development experience with container orchestration systems such as Docker, Kubernetes
•

Qualifications: Strong hands-on experience in developing software applications using Python and related technologies
Experience in building Django / Flask based App server, API development
Experience in developing applications from Scratch including an understanding of setting up the dependencies on the server
Good understanding of JavaScript, React, HTML, CSS
Knowledge of SDLC, Testing & CI/CD aspects such as Jenkins, BB, JIRA
Knowledge of Database concepts and ability to write SQL queries
Experience in developing distributed data processing systems
Knowledge of working on Distributed Autosys / Scheduling
Experience in developing software and services in cloud environments like AWS
Experience in snowflake

Python Developer

Python, Django is must

Job Description

& Responsibilities :
• Under broad direction and supervision, develops, maintains, and enhances client systems as well as designs and develops new features.
• Develops, maintains, enhances, and tests client systems of moderate to high complexity.
• Serves as the primary technical point of contact on client engagements of moderate to high complexity and of high value to the organization.
• Involved with the investigation and resolution of complex data, system, and software issues in the production environment.
• Under broad direction, designs and implements strategic partner integrations.
• Participates in the specification and design of new features at client or business request.
• Participates in the evaluation of new platforms, tools, and technologies.
• Develops and maintains internal tools. Performs other duties as assigned.
